alert.note: Alert for Westmoreland (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 05 at 9:30PM EDT until August 06 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pittsburgh has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... South Central Westmoreland County in southwestern Pennsylvania... * Until 200 AM EDT. * At 930 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported flash flooding across the warned area. Between 3 and 4.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Greensburg, Latrobe, McChesneytown-Loyalhanna, Derry, Lawson Heights, Calumet-Norvelt, New Alexandria, Youngstown and Crabtree. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
